reviews.sentence: Clean rooms and facilities. There were workers everyday cleaning the tops of door frames and vacuuming leaves off the sidewalks. The complex has everything you need from gift shop a couple of restaurants gym pool with a waterfall heated pool jacuzi beach access with showers and more. My girlfriend and I stayed in a room looking towards the water and it was beautiful. I would say the building is a bit old and needs a little renovation but overall extremely pleased with the service and quality for the price.
Weekend Get Away. Very quiet pleasant spot. Wonderful pool nice amenities. Did not visit the bar or restaurant. Many great sites with in walking distance.

Fort Walton Beach Hotel. The hotel had a great pool area. However the rooms are outdated and need to be updated. I think the price seemed a bit high to me considering it seemed kind of like an old beach hotel to me. Everyone was very nice and the lobby looked nice. The rooms just seemed old. There was garbage from a previous guest under our beds. Also the WIFI did not work at all while we were there for 3 days. Decent place. but I probably would not stay there again.
Nice lobby rest needs work. When you enter the lobby looks like a 4 star hotel. Rest of it looks like a Motel 6 on a bad day but with the 4 star prices. They need to put some into renovations.

Great Outdoor Amentities Horrible Hotel Rooms. This was our 5th time to stay at this Ramada in the last 10 years. We always look forward to the great outdoor amenities and they met our expectations to the fullest. However the hotel room was a completely different story. They are incredibly outdated but that does not even bother me. Upon arrival our key would not work so our entire lock had to be replaced on the door. The next day we had trouble with the key again. Our toilet continuously stopped up and we had to call maintenance. Our room phones went out and maintenance had to replace them and the phone lines. We were on a first name basis with maintenance. They were super nice and responded quickly but that is not really how we planned to spend our time. And our refrigerator was not very cool and some our our bath towels were stained. We were there July 30August 2 and they had already stopped all the kids activities during the day. Over all it was pretty disappointing for what we paid. As much as we have loved this place in the past unles they update the rooms it will be a thing of our past.

Quick Weekend Getaway. We took a quick stress relief trip to Ft Walton Beach and booked 2 rooms with beachside access view. The staff was very friendly and accommodating with our request for adjoining rooms. The rooms themselves are clean but the amenities on site really makes the stay worth while. There are several eateries located in the resort along with several bars. The kids loved the outdoor pool heated pool hot tub and water splash area. The Pier and Boardwalk is right next door not to mention the reason for the trip the beautiful beach. We will definitely book at this Ramada on any future return trip.
Husbands Retirement Birthday Break. From Reception to room with Champagne greeting us to room to Resteraunt and Bar our stay at Ramada was a very welcoming stay.

Decent Not for the OCD. The property offers quite a bit of amenities and is great for children i have older infant and toddler. It is right on top of the beach so that is great too. Some of the beach views are obstructed so try to get a room if you are looking for a beach view on the 3rd floor of higher. This room is NOT for the clean freak. There was sand in our beds some of our towels were damp and the place where the toilet paper sits is filthy. I could tell that they just did a quick straighten up rather than to give us fresh everything. We just called and asked for new stuff though. The wifi was spotty every 12 hours or so i believe you need to sign in each time which is annoying. Sprint had little to no service on the island also so be mindful. The employees working in maid service are wonderful and the lobby staff was cool. I would stay and plan to stay again with no hesitation.

Great for kids right on the beach Makes going to the beach with young kids easy. Three pools and a splash park allow you to escape the heat of the day on the beach. They have guys right on the beach you can rent equipment and beach chairs umbrellas from for your day. Really enjoyed our stay.
Great location and amenities. Hotel is showing its age and walls are very thin so it can get very noisy.
Great except for loud noises from elevator at night.

Under Cunstruction. When booking this room we were not informed they where under construction. When we arrived we were told they pool and other amenities were under construction. Room was ok but carpets were dirty along with towels were worn and stained.

Worst stay ever. Reserved a room a full month in advance for the slow time of year. Ocean front with a balcony. My wife and I have stayed their a few times with good service. Arrived 15 minutes before check in and time and was told all the upper room floors with views were gone and I was given a ground level room with no balcony or view of the ocean. It was the worst room in the hotel next to the ice maker and to the only elevator. Also next to only entrance and exit to the beach from the hotel. Only wanted to sit on the balcony and relax after losing my wife this past year. Nothing done so I checked out after that night and went back home. Nice memory. Will never stay in another Wyndham hotel.

Would not recommend. First day we got to our room and noticed the grotto pool was under construction. Walked into our room and some painters were on the outside balcony. After a long drive I wanted to take a nap and was exhausted. The noise from the construction did not allow me to do that. I called the front desk and asked to move rooms. They moved me right down the hall from original room. So here we are again on the third day being woken up by the noise at 8 am which I was already woke up in the middle of the night by the large group of what I assume to be teenage boys throwing a party in their room right next to me. If I could get a refund and switch to a different hotel I would.
Pleasant. Construction going on there and the main pool was closed. Front lobby under construction also.

My stay was short and sweet the front lobby is currently being renovated so I can not speak to the overall aesthetic. But the prices are good for the area the amenities are fitting for how much you pay and the room I stayed in was clean and well maintained.

Beach courtyard housekeeping was outstanding room and facilities were subpar at best. View was excellent service and support staff were outstanding. Especially house keeping. Was not made aware there was construction and pool closure until arrival. Room was out dated there should have been prior notification of of construction. Would not honor government rate upon arrival as room had already been paid for. No additional compensations for government rate benefits. Supposedly was to recieve complementary breakfast daily was not received. No benefits or comps for Wyndham rewards guests received.

Disappointing. Hotel was on remodel so it was extremely disappointing. Out of every amenity the heated pool was the only thing working. Save your money and go somewhere else. We spent 400 for a hotel with a pool and did not even get beachfront. could have went somewhere alot better. Will not visit here again.

Not worth your money if you want to be on the beach I suggest looking elsewhere. While this is about all the hotel has to offer they have failed the mark on realizing there is more to a stay than a beach front property. 1parking is limited because there is construction EVERYWHERE. 2hotel is outdated and it shows. Not worth the price on view alone. 3Did I mention the construction. No mention of this anywhere before booking. Breakfast was under a tent that was subpar and not worth the 11. I could have gotten a McD bfast for less and been just as satisfied. I get it. it ’s time to upgrade and cash in on the location. But to be under the starting stages of it when the good weather and travel time come who logisticaly planned that. I encourage you too seek other accommodations before booking and making this your last option. And preferably as just a place to sleep. This is hardly a resort that you ’d want to visit. The employees are nice and I can only imagine the beating they are taking from guests so kudos to them for putting a smile on their face. But corporate listen to your reviews and offer guests maybe fee breakfast during this transition free beach rentals or even just an honest policy that there is major renovation happening. The price of this hotel DOES NOT reflect the property.

Disappointed. The view from the room. The dirtiness of the facility. Even without the renovation going on the facility is in poor condition. The pictures online are very misleading and do not represent the quality of place you will be staying at.

The hotel lobby and grounds are very nice. It has a couple really nice pools and a swim up bar. They have neat little restaurants and a beach side bar all on the premises but the rooms are EXTREMELY out dated and smell horribly. This property was built in 196 and from the looks of it the rooms have never been touched. it is very deceiving compared to the hotel lobby and from exterior which is very up to date modern and luxurious. Honestly do nt think I will stay here again until the rooms are updated but for the price I suppose you get what you pay for.
Very Poor. The rooms were outdated and smelled like mildew. The room was far from inviting and overpriced for the accommodations.

I loved the location of this hotel. The beach was beautiful and the staff were very nice. The property location was great. The view from our gulf facing room was so beautiful. I loved having a balcony to sit and watch the water. They were doing some renovations so it will be even nicer when that is done. Our room needed updating. Breakfast did not have a very big selection and not worth it unles you get it included in the price of your room. It was spring break so there were a lot of young people partying and the smell of alcohol was all over inside the halls. Our air conditioner in the room was very loud.

Read Every Review Before You Book. I booked this hotel through Priceline. We booked the Gulf King room and were given a double queen room instead. The double queen room is over 100 cheaper which is very misleading and poor business. The hotel is completely under construction. The amenities they talk up are not in use. The room we were given felt sticky. The pillows and sheets were dirty and the toiletries were used. Priceline could not help the situation and the front desk did not bother to help either. We did not even stay in the hotel we left. Do not be fooled by great photos of the lobby. The hotel itself is a complete facade. There is no way this is luxury.

Staff was great. hotel was just ok. The staff was wonderful and helpful the lobby was beautiful but everything else was just ok. The pictures are deceiving because the ones shown are just the beachfront area. Most of the rooms have an outside entrance. They have updated the floors new tile the bed was clean but room was definitely dated. The weather stripping around our door was barely there. You could see sunlight entering around the door. There was paint peeling in a lot of areas and the walls are thin. The parking lot is extremely narrow so you are better off using the parking garage. It has more of a motel feel than a hotel.

I have stayed here once before when it was a Ramada. The hotel itself looked a bit outdated at the time but it was clean and overall a good experience. That was not the case this time. The location of this hotel and the amenities surrounding it are great however the renovations that are being done seem a little “ janky ” For example brand new floor in our room already had a spot where it was coming up behind the toilet and the door was n’t put on the hinges correctly to the bathroom. It stuck and made a horrible noise every time we opened and or closed it. Great for those using it in the middle of the night. I also noticed there was n’t anything displaying on the alarm clock thought maybe it was broken but it was n’t even plugged into the wall. There was also time left in the microwave not big deals there but it ’s just the attention to detail was obviously overlooked when preparing our room for us which is made even more apparent for this next part. The cleanliness. The hallway carpets were DISGUSTINGLY dirty when walking through. There was a streak of dried mud on the floor when we walked in a GIANT green booger wiped on the wall next to where we slept GROSS. Had I noticed this before we were about to check out we would have left sooner. When I went to check out the lady at the desk was kind and ready to help me do just that nothing else. No small talk and did not ask me how my stay was or my room. I was just ready to get out of there.

What a mix of experiences here. FIRST AND FOREMOST there are NO ELEVATORS in some of the multi floor buildings. Truly hard to believe in todays hotel experiences but be forewarned. The staff is nice but young inexperienced and as a result they do not think things through when it comes to accommodating the guest. So they originally put me in a two story building on the 2nd floor with no elevators AND it is undergoing renovations. As a result the parking lot adjacent to it is closed. Completely. Yet when I finally thought to ask they had a ground floor room right behind the front reception area that was available same price all along. Its a touristy beach property. it is a good facility could use some work. Rooms are a tile floor and should you walk barefoot on it you are going to want to wash your feet before getting in bed or putting on socks or shoes. they have got those little black bugs flying around in the rooms. Probably some better pest services could fix it. It does seem to be a family friendly facility and is in a good location. There are several pools and if you want to do laps true lap swimming they are plenty long enough to do so. Be warned in May they are not heating them as they say it is not summer and and at least the large one I was in is cold. well under 80 degrees.

Beach will bring me back not the hotel. The location is great but the hotel is a bit older and definitely showing its age. Apparently currently remodeled. the lobby is beautiful. However the rooms are showing their age tiles in hallway leading to room Appear rusted coming up. The 2 elevators move super slow and make a lot of noise. The same attention that was put into Lobby was not put into the rooms. I believe this property was once a Motel 6 that has been revamped. Which would explain our awkward suite layout. It appears to have been two rooms that was joined to make one. There was not a table in room only end table which made it difficult with kids. In terms of cleanliness the room definitely could be cleaner. Overall not impressed. I will search for another location next family trip.
Stayed 2 nights had great time. pool awesome. halls were wet from leaking water and toilet in room was about to go through the floor. Has smell in hall ways.
